title: GWTG-Heart Failure Risk Score
description: Predicts all-cause in-hospital mortality in admitted patients with heart failure using validated AHA Get With The Guidelines data

parameters.name: age
parameters.description: Patient age in years (older age increases risk score)

parameters.name: systolic_bp
parameters.description: Systolic blood pressure in mmHg (lower values increase risk)

parameters.name: bun
parameters.description: Blood urea nitrogen in mg/dL (higher values increase risk)

parameters.name: heart_rate
parameters.description: Heart rate in beats per minute (higher values increase risk)

parameters.name: sodium
parameters.description: Serum sodium in mEq/L (lower values increase risk)

parameters.name: copd
parameters.description: History of chronic obstructive pulmonary disease

parameters.name: black_race
parameters.description: Patient race (black race is protective factor in this score)

result.name: mortality_risk
result.description: Predicted in-hospital mortality risk for heart failure patients

ranges.interpretation: Very low risk of in-hospital mortality (<1%). Standard heart failure care protocols appropriate.
Low risk of in-hospital mortality (1-5%). Standard care with attention to optimization of heart failure therapy.
Moderate risk of in-hospital mortality (5-15%). Consider enhanced monitoring and aggressive heart failure management.
High risk of in-hospital mortality (15-30%). Implement intensive monitoring, consider advanced therapies and palliative care discussions.
Very high risk of in-hospital mortality (>30%). Intensive care management, advanced heart failure therapies, and end-of-life care planning discussions recommended.

references: Peterson PN, Rumsfeld JS, Liang L, et al. A validated risk score for in-hospital mortality in patients with heart failure from the American Heart Association get with the guidelines program. Circ Cardiovasc Qual Outcomes. 2010;3(1):25-32. doi: 10.1161/CIRCOUTCOMES.109.854877

Fonarow GC, Adams KF Jr, Abraham WT, Yancy CW, Boscardin WJ; ADHERE Scientific Advisory Committee, Study Group, and Investigators. Risk stratification for in-hospital mortality in acutely decompensated heart failure: classification and regression tree analysis. JAMA. 2005;293(5):572-580.
American Heart Association Get With The Guidelines - Heart Failure Program. https://www.heart.org/en/professional/quality-improvement/get-with-the-guidelines
formula: Score (0-100 points) = sum of points from age, systolic BP, BUN, heart rate, sodium, COPD (+2 if yes), and race (+4 if non-black, +1 if black). Mortality risk calculated from score ranges.
notes: Developed using AHA Get With The Guidelines-Heart Failure program data from 39,783 patients from 198 hospitals
Model demonstrated good discrimination with C-index of 0.75 in both derivation and validation datasets
In-hospital mortality rate was 2.86% overall, with risk varying 24-fold across score deciles (0.4% to 9.7%)
Score is applicable to broad spectrum of heart failure patients including those with preserved ejection fraction
Validated for risk stratification in various clinical settings including cardiac intensive care units
Should be used in conjunction with clinical judgment for comprehensive heart failure management
